text: Back in the days when I was a rookie in the police force, the Chief was a veteran.
keypoint: Recalling rookie days and the veteran Chief

text: He had caught a notorious criminal – or had been awarded for bravery.
keypoint: Chief’s reputation for bravery and crime-fighting

text: But he had – a young daughter.
And in those days I was a fitness enthusiast. And it seemed she was trying to impress me. I never observed it.
keypoint: I was a fitness enthusiast; she tried to impress me

text: Truth is I wasn't very fond of her because she was – She was a charming girl until she opened her mouth. She was a chatterbox. Goodness, she could talk.
keypoint: I disliked her for being overly talkative

text: Then she left a message one day saying she was going to run away because he was always scolding her about me.
keypoint: She threatened to run away over her father’s scolding

text: He arrived at my apartment. Big intimidating look on his face. I managed to calm him down.
keypoint: Chief arrived upset; I calmed him down

text: and proposed “Well we'll search for her and if we can't locate her well you can – do whatever you think is right.” I was strategizing. So he accepted my offer.
keypoint: I proposed searching for her; Chief agreed

text: And we went to where they found her scarf – near a park. and we traced down a little more and we couldn't locate her.
keypoint: We searched near the park but couldn’t find her

text: And returned – it was a police station – she was sitting on a chair with a book in her hands. She hadn't run away.
keypoint: Returned to police station; she was safe and hadn’t run away

text: But – nevertheless – that resolved the issue for that day.
keypoint: The issue was resolved for that day

text: But that evening the deputy, Frank Mitchell, said “You better transfer and leave because that old man never forgets anything once he gets it into his mind.”
keypoint: Deputy warned me to transfer and leave

text: And I did. I transferred. and left.
keypoint: I followed the advice and left

text: That was the end of my rookie year.
keypoint: That marked the end of my rookie year
